page.title: 16NOTTINGHAM(ST.ANN'S) HOUSING
page.content: The{St.Ann's}area of{Nottingham} has had a period of slum clearance since the late 1960's.Many of the Victorian terraced buildings have been demolished,to make way for modern housing.A lot of the allotments that were used in St.Ann's have been built on. In our area,there is a housing estate,owned by Metropolitan.We pay rent to the owners.The local housing estates in St.Ann's are quite new.The heating for some of the housing is pumped to the houses from an incinerator. The rubbish is burnt and changed into heat. Some of the older houses still exsist.Many are council houses , but some have been bought from the council.
